declarations.comments:
Represents a value with a List of Measures with Exponents `value [m² * s³]`

Types are constructed using the type aliases provided by the Base Units: 

`Measured Int (Meter N3 ())` which represents Int with Unit `[1/m³]``

The infix operator `:` allows for simpler syntax: `Int : Meter N3 ()`
declarations.title: Measured

declarations.comments: Proxy from kind Measure to kind Type
declarations.title: MProxy

declarations.comments: Base Measure with an Exponent. Represents `m^exp`
declarations.title: MeasureExp

declarations.comments:
Combines two sequential same symbols by adding their values

Example: `Combine (m², m¹, s¹, s¹, kg) (m³, s², kg)`
declarations.title: Combine

declarations.comments: Adds two rows, adding entries with the same type
declarations.title: AddRows

declarations.comments: Invert a Row: `InserseRow (Meter P1 * Sec N3 ()) (Meter N1 * Sec N3 ())`
declarations.title: InverseRow

declarations.comments: lifts a Value to a unitless Measured
declarations.title: liftV

declarations.comments:
"Multiply" Measures: `(Meter P1 * Sec N2 * ()) ≡ (Meter P1 (Sec N2 ()))`

Note: The last `*` can be omitted `Sec N2 * () ≡ Sec N2 ()`
declarations.title: type (*)

declarations.comments: Add Unit to a value: `(Int : Meter P1 ()) ≡ Measured Int (Meter P1 ())`
declarations.title: type (:)

declarations.comments:
Meter with default exponent 1

`Sec P2 * Meter' * Kg () ≡ Sec P2 * Meter P1 * Kg ()`
declarations.title: Meter'
